org.tigr.antware.shared.util
Class GetOptLong

java.lang.Object
  org.tigr.antware.shared.util.GetOptLong

public class GetOptLong
extends Object

The GetOptLong class provides java programs with a way to interpret and parse command line options. It allows for the parsing to be configured intitially by sending an array of configuration strings which then control how the command line is parsed and the results are returned. This class attempts to enforce adherence to the GNU standard of specifying options, which specify that long parameter names be prepended with a double dash. Options which are specified with only a single letter may take only a single dash. Using a double dash with a single character option name will generate a warning message, or, if stricture is used, an exception is thrown. Currently, no support is available for mandatory options. Options that were specified in the configuration but were subsequently omitted in the command line, are not present in the HashMap that is returned. Client code must perform validation of the presence or absence of options if such a requirement exists. A double-dash by itself on the command line, is interpreted in the standard way. That is, it halts the parsing of the command line. The remaining arguments are available in the remainingArgs hash, or through the getRemaining() method. TO DO: 1. Support mandatory options. 2. Support grouping of single letter short options: -a -b -c => -abc 3. Support case-insensitivity.

All rights reserved.

Method Detail

isLongOption

private static boolean isLongOption(String pArg)
Returns a boolean indicating whether or not a string is a long command line option. Specifically, it must begin with exactly two dashes. If the string begins with three options or more, then we print an error message and return false.

Parameters:
The - argument (string) to check.
Returns:
True if the string is a long option.

Parameters:

Returns:
True if the string is a long option.

True if the string is a short option.

getRemaining

public String getRemaining(int pRemaining)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException
This method returns a specific member of the remainingArgs array of strings. The remainingArgs array is populated when a command line terminator " -- " switch is encountered on the command line. If the index number provided is too large, then the last element of the array is returned.

Parameters:
param - The integer number of the remaining argument to return.
Returns:
A string containing the nth command line argument after a -- .
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException

Parameters:

setConfig

public void setConfig(String config)
This method is to add additional configuration specifications before parsing a command line's set of arguments. Specification strings can be used to retrieve strings, integers, longs, bytes, floats as well as flag options. Flag options are those that are specified on the command line with no associated value and generally have a boolean nature. An example would be --verbose, or --help. The mere presence of the flag on the command line provides the value (true or false). For the remaining types of specification strings, a value is required, usually in the next argument, or specified after an equals sign When setting up the configuration, specify a flag simply passing the name of the flag. For strings pass the name of the flag appended with an identifier "=s". The identifier signals getOptions to check for and return a string value for that option. For the remaining types, the identifiers are: "=c" for characters, "=f" for floats, "=l" for longs, "=d" for doubles, and finally "=i" for integers.

Parameters:
config, - a configuration string.

setConfigOptions

private void setConfigOptions(String[] pFinalConfig)
This private method sets up the configOptions hash map with the appropriate values according to the specifications the user passed in with the constructor or the setConfig method.

Parameters:
pFinalConfig, - a configuration string.

truncateTerminatedArgs

private String[] truncateTerminatedArgs(String[] pCommandLineArgs)
Private method to return the list of arguments that come before the option terminator --, and sets the remainingArgs string array to include the arguments after the terminator, in the proper order.

Parameters:
The - array of strings representing the raw command line args.
Returns:
relevantArgs, an array of strings containing the relevant command line argsments (those that occur before a lone -- ).
